pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:6.2: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī approached the Order of nuns and asked for approval to give a full ordination.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:6.4: decided that she should not, and so they did not give her the approval.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:6.6: Soon afterwards the Order of nuns gave approval to other nuns to give full ordinations.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:6.8: “So it seems I’m ignorant and shameless,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:6.9: since the Order gives approval to other nuns to give full ordinations, but not to me.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:7.3: consent to not being approved to give a full ordination, and then criticize it afterwards?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:7.8: consent to not being approved to give a full ordination, and then criticize it afterwards?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:8.1: ‘If a nun is told, “Venerable, you have given enough full ordinations for now,” and she consents, saying, “It is well,” but then criticizes it afterwards, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:10.1: Venerable, you have given enough full ordinations for now:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:10.2: Venerable, you have given enough full ordinations for now.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:10.3: If she consents, saying, ‘It is well,’ but then criticizes it afterwards, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:11.2: if she criticizes one who normally acts from desire, ill-will, confusion, or fear;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:11.4: if she is the first offender.
